mechanoreception.notes: As arachnids and whip scorpions, Charinidae likely possess sensitive mechanoreceptors for detecting vibrations and tactile stimuli in their environment. Pedipalps are modified for prey capture and sensory input.

chemoreception.notes: Likely use chemoreceptors to detect prey and navigate their environment, as observed in other arachnids.

vision.notes: The extent and capabilities of vision in Charinidae are unknown based on the provided context. Other Amblypygi families may show variations.
